contentrichtext.text: '''Khodayyir Abbas''' was [[Minister of Health]] in the cabinet appointed by the [[Interim Iraq Governing Council]] in September 2003. A [[Shia]] Muslim and surgeon, member of the [[United Kingdom|UK]] [[Royal College of Surgeons of England|Royal College of Surgeons]], he is a member of the [[Daawa Party]]. ==References== * {{cite web| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/3199561.stm| title=Iraq's post-war cabinet| accessdate=2006-02-24| author=BBC News| date=2003-09-01}} {{s-start}} {{succession box | title=Minister of Health| before=[[Coalition Provisional Authority]]| years= September 2003â€“June 2004| after=[[Alaa Abdessaheb al-Alwan]] }} {{s-end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Abbas, Khodayyir | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Iraqi government minister | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Abbas, Khodayyir}} [[Category:Government ministers of Iraq]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Iraqi Shia Muslims]] [[Category:Islamic Dawa Party politicians]] {{Iraq-politician-stub}}
